column4: is there any ubuntu release with desktop edition with lamp already installed
not a desktop edition
but you could do a server lamp instlal then just sudo aptitude install ubuntu-desktop
when you try to do what?  install ubuntu-desktop on the server?
well yeah you need to get the network working first.
or you could add the desktop cd as a repo then instlal that way
but you would still have no net access.
what is it exactly you are trying to accomplish?
well what type of card do you have?
What type of network card that is...
lspci | grep Ethernet
should show you the chipset.
well lamp is just Linux Apache Mysql and Php.  ITs not that hard to install them. on any system.
well getting the network card working would be step one.
then installing software would be step 2.  Because a webserver without working network is kind of pointless
okay well then all you need to do is install apache mysql and php right?
you should be able to find all of those in synaptic.
your default webpage will go in /var/www
and you can get to it by pointing your browser on that machine to 127.0.0.1
did you install php?
and the libmod for apache?
then restart the apache after install php and it should work.
sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart
